column4: how to disable boot scripts on startup like 0dns-down and time synchroning?
use update-rc.d to remove the symbolic links from the appropriate run levels
at the command do something like, "update-rc.d -f whatever_script.sh remove"
what is scripts name that checks "0dns-down" and time synchoning with ubuntulinux.org
That will remove it from all of the run levels.
I think that would be dns-clean
and the time sync happens with ntpdate... I think.  I use ntp-server but I think the default is ntpdate.
by the way, how to get  kernel source?
ok, i will try it later
probably apt-get install linux-source-2.x.x or something similar...  just do a, "apt-cache search kernel-source" and you should be able to find what you need.
